DataElement.preferredName: Patient Kaposi Sarcoma Cohort Study Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response regarding patient enrollment in the cohort study and meets the clinical trial eligibility criteria, as outlined in the protocol, for study participation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Kaposi Sarcoma Cohort Study Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._Studies in which subsets of a defined population are identified. These groups may or may not be exposed to factors hypothesized to influence the probability of the occurrence of a particular disease or other outcome. Cohorts are defined populations which, as a whole, are followed in an attempt to determine distinguishing subgroup characteristics._The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Cohort Study Enrollment Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Studies in which subsets of a defined population are identified. These groups may or may not be exposed to factors hypothesized to influence the probability of the occurrence of a particular disease or other outcome. Cohorts are defined populations which, as a whole, are followed in an attempt to determine distinguishing subgroup characteristics.:The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).

A research study that compares a particular outcome (such as lung cancer) in groups of individuals who are alike in many ways but differ by a certain characteristic (for example, female nurses who smoke compared with those who do not smoke).
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: If patient has Kaposi sarcoma
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has Kaposi sarcoma impacting physical and/or psychological wellbeing and not amenable to local therapy, are the following criteria met: On ART with suppressed HIV viral load for greater than 3 months (Note: an extended washout period is needed to avoid treatment during the period of risk for the highly toxic and often fatal Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (IRIS); No KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease in past 5 years; No symptomatic pulmonary KS or chest X-rays positive for un-evaluated abnormalities; Disease evaluable by AIDS Clinical Trial Group (ACTG) KS response criteria; CD4+ T-cell count greater than or equal to 50 cells/uL; and the following laboratory values which supersede the values in section 3.1.6:  platelet count greater than lower limit of normal and hemoglobin greater than 10 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has treatment naïve Kaposi sarcoma (Cohort 4) impacting physical and/or psychological wellbeing and not amenable to local therapy are the following criteria met: On ART with suppressed HIV viral load for greater than 3 months (Note: an extended washout period is needed to avoid treatment during the period of risk for the highly toxic and often fatal "Immune Reconstitution Inflammatory Syndrome (IRIS)"; No KSHV-associated multicentric Castleman disease in past 5 years; No-prior systemic cancer chemotherapy; No symptomatic pulmonary KS or chest X-rays positive for un-evaluated abnormalities; Disease evaluable by AIDS Clinical Trial Group (ACTG) KS response criteria; CD4+ T-cell count greater than or equal to 100 cells/μL; and the following laboratory values which supersede the values in section 3.1.6:  platelet count greater than lower limit of normal and hemoglobin greater than 10 g/dL?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is in the expansion cohort, does patient have histologic, cytologic, and pathologic confirmation of Kaposi Sarcoma (KS)?

DataElement.origin: CITN CRF: Cancer Immunotherapy Trials Network Case Report Form
